arts.ttl: Arsenal injury and suspension latest for Brighton amid Havertz and Timber blow
arts.sum: With that being said, football.london has taken a look at the latest Arsenal injury news alongside other reasons why key players may miss out. Havertz was a noticeable absentee from the Arsenal matchday squad to face Brentford with it later confirmed he missed out due to illness and judging by Arteta's words, he may not have been ready to play.

arts.ttl: Mbuemo passes Arsenal transfer audition as Arteta offered £78m January chance
arts.sum: Unlike Mbeumo, it is very likely that Randal Kolo Muani leaves Paris Saint-Germain in January just 18 months on from signing for £78million and a move to the Premier League is possible. With that being said, football.london has taken a look at the latest Gunners transfer rumours which includes two attackers that could make the switch to Emirates Stadium.

arts.ttl: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal prioritize Juventus' Vlahovic
arts.sum: Arsenal have Dusan Vlahovic atop their shortlist. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

arts.ttl: Arsenal transfer latest: Update as Arsenal, Mikel Arteta look for January window Bukayo Saka replacement
arts.sum: Arsenal are exploring wide attacking options in the January transfer window in light of Bukayo Saka's hamstring injury, and could bring their summer business forward.

arts.ttl: Arteta sings virtues of ‘versatility’ as Arsenal overcome sickness bug to win
arts.athr: Ed Aarons at the Gtech Community Stadium
arts.sum: Manager says team is not too stretched in hectic schedule Ethan Nwaneri picked on merit in Saka’s role at Brentford Mikel Arteta praised his players’ fortitude after a patched-up Arsenal side overcame a sickness bug in the squad to defeat Brentford and keep up the pressure on Liverpool. Kai Havertz was forced to miss the trip to west London because of illness but goals from Gabriel Jesus, Mikel Merino and Gabriel Martinelli enabled Arteta’s side to recover from going behind to Bryan Mbeumo’s 11th league goal of the season. The victory leaves them six points behind the leaders, albeit from a game more, before Saturday’s visit to Brighton. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Mikel Arteta drops new hint on Arsenal's January transfer plans: "We will look at it"
arts.sum: Arsenal have been linked to a number of transfers this month but Gunners boss Mikel Arteta appeared to play down the suggestion of his side definitely conducting business

arts.ttl: Did win at Brentford suggest Arsenal need January signings?
arts.sum: With the January transfer window officially open, Arsenal will have to assess on how they do business with multiple games coming thick and fast.

arts.ttl: 'No-one can replace Saka' - but Nwaneri, 17, gives Arsenal hope
arts.sum: With Bukayo Saka out until March, 17-year-old Ethan Nwaneri shows glimpses against Brentford to give Arsenal hope.

arts.ttl: Arsenal find balance without Saka - do they still need a forward?
arts.sum: One-nil down, talisman injured, a sickness bug going through the squad and getting further adrift in the title race. For half an hour, Arsenal felt the cold at Brentford.

arts.ttl: Arsenal make transfer approach to sign striker amid Newcastle contact
arts.sum: Both Newcastle and Arsenal are said to have been following the progress of the attacker since he made his first-team debut in the summer. After scoring his first league goal against St Johnstone, Mooney assisted St Mirren's winner against Rangers on Boxing Day.
